Module it.polimi.ingsw
Package it.polimi.ingsw.client.controller.commandHandlers

Class CliCommandHandler

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.client.controller.commandHandlers.CliCommandHandler
Direct Known Subclasses:
ChatCommandHandler, HelpCommandHandler, JoinGameCommandHandler, LoginCommandHandler, PickFromBoardCommandHandler, PlayersNumberCommandHandler, QuitCommandHandler, ReloadGameCommandHandler, SelectColumnCommandHandler, ShowViewCommandHandler
public abstract class CliCommandHandler extends Object
These type of classes handles the validation of a command inserted in the cli by the user, based on the parameters and the current game phase.
Author:
Daniele Ferrario

    This class describes the handlers for the available commands for the cli.

  • Constructor Details

    • CliCommandHandler

      public CliCommandHandler(Cli cli)
      This class describes the handlers for the available commands for the cli. They will check the syntax and the current ClientStatus for the command to be valid, and then the cli will be notified with the payload generated by the command.
      Parameters:
      cli -

  • Method Details

    • execute

      public abstract void execute(String commandInput, ClientState state) throws BadlyFormattedParametersException, CommandNotAvailableInThisPhaseException
      This method is invoked to evaluate the user's command. If the command is parsed successfully, the listeners in the cli will be notified with the result related to the command.
      Parameters:
      commandInput - The user's input
      state - the current state of the client
      Throws:
      BadlyFormattedParametersException - The inserted parameters are not valid for this specific command.
      CommandNotAvailableInThisPhaseException - The command cannot be invoked during the current game phase.

    • checkParameters

      protected abstract boolean checkParameters(List<String> parameters)
      Checks if the inserted parameters are valid for this command.
      Parameters:
      parameters - the list of parameters after the command. ex: "/send "hi guys" --to Pippo Pluto parameters = {"hi guys", "--to", "Pippo", "Pluto"}
      Returns:
      if command is valid.

    • getCli

      public Cli getCli()

    • checkAvailability

      protected boolean checkAvailability(HashSet<ClientPhasesEnum> availablePhases, ClientState state)
      Checks if the command is available in the current phase
      Parameters:
      availablePhases - the list of available phases
      state - client state containing the currente state
      Returns:
      whether the command is available

      public abstract String getCommandDescription()

      public List<String> splitAndTrimInput(String input)
